pros: The freedom to meet and network while on the field and school.
Helping people in continuing their education and flexible work hours.
cons: No structure what so ever. Lack of management and no room for grown.

pros: The gratification I receive from helping people pursue their education and the comradely I've developed with my colleagues are the only pro's that I can think of off the top of my head.
cons: The college is embarrassingly behind in terms of technology, there are no added incentives or bonuses for recruiters meeting quota's, the administration micro manages which prevents innovative thinking and demoralizes passionate employees, the college is not up to par with basic college standards, the management is stuck in the past and refuses to put fresh innovative people into leadership roles, the retention rate is constantly low, and finally success is not recognized or rewarded.

review_title: My experience at Boricua College has been rewarding and uplifting. The enviornment is very diversified.
pros: The best reasons to work here are the hours which can be flexible and the supportive co-workers.
cons: Outdated policies towards recruitment and lack of communication with the new/young staff.

pros: The only good thing about this place is flexibility.
cons: This place lacks professionalism and is full of sex offenders that have never been reported officially to authorities. Been here for a while with no raise and there is no room for professional growth.

job_title: Office Administrator in New York, NY
pros: Equal opportunity for those persons that could not be accepted into other mainstream colleges.
cons: No sense of support amongst all adminstrators or school officials within the college or other campuses.

pros: Balance life and work. Good environment and competitive Professors.
cons: Need to upgrade infrastructure, and upgrade the technology services for students.

pros: Excellent place to work.  Family environment
cons: Boricua College is a great place to work.  There are no cons

pros: None for outsiders and very little for insiders
cons: Unprofessional, Poor management skills which effects mid n lower level employees along with way to much favoritism
